required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 10+10+30 Infant Vaccines Communication Via Radio in Ethiopia
clinical_study.official_title: 10+10+30 Infant Vaccines Communication Via Radio in Ethiopia

brief_summary.textblock: A cohort study to investigate the effectiveness of radio intervention comprising 10-minute of drama, 10-minute of discussion led by community extension workers, and 30-minute phone-in from listeners on childhood vaccination coverage and timeliness

detailed_description.textblock:
The evaluation is conducted in 2 districts located in the Oromia region of Ethiopia. One of the districts will be allocated to receive the 3-month radio intervention while the other district that will not have access to the radio intervention will serve as the control.
Data collection includes survey of mothers at two "key" times: at baseline (when infants are at most 5 weeks old; but before beginning the intervention) and at endline (including examination of infant vaccination records) at most 21 days after the end of the radio intervention. The same mothers and infants to be followed at endline.

study_design_info.masking_description: Data analyst did not know which group received the intervention

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 weeks after the intervention ends
primary_outcome.description: Infant's vaccination record or mother's recall based on interviewer-administered questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 weeks after the intervention ends
secondary_outcome.description: Infant's vaccination record or mother's recall based on interviewer-administered questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 weeks after the intervention ends
secondary_outcome.description: Infant's vaccination record or mother's recall based on a questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before intervention starts, and up to 3 weeks after the intervention ends
secondary_outcome.description: Mother completes interviewer-administered questionnaire at specified times

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived susceptibility to vaccine-preventable diseases in children
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before intervention starts, and up to 3 weeks after the intervention ends
secondary_outcome.description: Mother completes interviewer-administered questionnaire at specified times

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before intervention starts, and up to 3 weeks after the intervention ends
secondary_outcome.description: Mother completes interviewer-administered questionnaire at specified times

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived severity of vaccine-preventable diseases in children
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before intervention starts, and up to 3 weeks after the intervention ends
secondary_outcome.description: Mother completes interviewer-administered questionnaire at specified times

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before intervention starts, and up to 3 weeks after the intervention ends
secondary_outcome.description: Mother completes interviewer-administered questionnaire at specified times

arm_group.description: A district where the radio intervention will be broadcast.
A district where the radio intervention will not be broadcast.

intervention.description: Radio intervention comprising 10-minute drama, 10-minute discussion of the drama by trained health extension workers and 30-minute phone-in from listeners

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Mother, with infant of at most 5 weeks old; Lives in the study district; Consents to participate in study
Exclusion Criteria:
Mother, with infant of more than 5 weeks old; Does not live in study district; Does not consent to participate in study

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified data will be shared upon reasonable request after data analysis. Email Dr. Bernard Appiah at beappiah@syr.edu
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Will be accessible as part of open access publishing
